# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a concise implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(s::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length("$current_line $word") > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = strip("$word ")
        else
            current_line *= " $word"
        end
    end
    if !iszero(length(current_line))
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```
Here's an example usage:
```julia
println(wrap_string("This is an example string with many words"))
```
